org.mocksy.rules
Interface Rule

All Known Implementing Classes:
HttpProxyRule, ResponseRule, RulesetRule
public interface Rule

A Rule is the basic function in Mocksy. It takes a Request and converts it into a Response with the process(Request) method. The associated Matchers are used to determine the suitability of this Rule for the given Request. There are two main Rule implementations: ResponseRule and RulesetRule. The former creates a Response object directly, while the latter delegates to another set of Rules.

Author:
Saleem Shafi

Method Summary
 void addMatcher(Matcher matcher)
          Adds a Matcher to this Rule.
 Collection<Matcher> getMatchers()
          Returns the list of Matchers used to determine the suitability of this Rule for processing a given Request.
 boolean matches(Request request)
          Evaluates the Request to see if this Rule can be used to generate the Response.
 Response process(Request request)
          Processes the given Request.
 

Method Detail

addMatcher

void addMatcher(Matcher matcher)
Adds a Matcher to this Rule. All Matchers have to match the Request during processing for the rule to take effect.

Parameters:
matcher - the Matcher to add

matches

boolean matches(Request request)
Evaluates the Request to see if this Rule can be used to generate the Response. Generally, if all of the associated Matchers match the Request, then this should return true; otherwise, if any of the Matchers don't like the Request, it should return false.

Parameters:
request -
Returns:
whether or not this Rule can handle the given Request

process

Response process(Request request)
                 throws Exception
Processes the given Request. The matches(Request) method should be invoked to ensure that this Rule should even be used for this Request before calling process(Request).

Parameters:
request - the Request to process
Returns:
the Response that this Rule creates for the given Request
Throws:
Exception

getMatchers

Collection<Matcher> getMatchers()
Returns the list of Matchers used to determine the suitability of this Rule for processing a given Request.

Returns:
list of Matchers for this Rule
